original_title: Sri Lanka expressway revenue surges in New Year holiday
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s fee levying expressways have generated sharply higher revenues on a traditional New Year holiday in April, an official said as domestic tourism picked up and people visited distant relatives.
On April 15 and 16, total fees of 70,558,100 were collected from vehicles that used the expressway, Road Development Authority (RDA) Project Director L.V. Sardha Weerakoon told EconomyNext.

Expressways had carried 126,760 vehicles on April 15, generating revenues of 34,974,100 rupees on April 15, while 129,465 vehicles had used the roads on April 16, netting revenues of 35,584,000 rupees.
On a normal day, the expressway generates approximately around 20 to 25 million rupees a day, Weerakoon said.
